intro: Vriesea tequendamae, commonly known as the Tequendama bromeliad, is a striking plant native to Colombia. It is characterized by its vibrant, colorful inflorescence that can range from red to orange and yellow. The plant has a rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves that form a central tank to collect water. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil. Vriesea tequendamae is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
